Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A national, standardized, publicly reported satisfaction survey of a patients' perspectives of their hospital experience. It is required by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services for all hospitals in the United States.

Concepts.longName: Hospital Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems
Concepts.definition: A national, standardized, publicly reported satisfaction survey of a patients' perspectives of their hospital experience. It is required by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services for all hospitals in the United States.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Published by the The Regenstrief Institute, the Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes covers clinical and clinical laboratory terminology.

Concepts.longName: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes
Concepts.definition: Published by The Regenstrief Institute, the Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes covers clinical and clinical laboratory terminology.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient Reported Outcomes Version of CTCAE

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcomes Version of CTCAE
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A library of items for patient self-reporting of symptoms and side effects associated with cancer treatment trials.

Concepts.longName: Patient Reported Outcomes Version of CTCAE
Concepts.definition: A library of items for patient self-reporting of symptoms and side effects associated with cancer treatment trials.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of neuro-behavioral measures that assess cognitive, emotional, sensory, and motor functions, designed to be run on an iPad.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of neuro-behavioral measures that assess cognitive, emotional, sensory, and motor functions, designed to be run on an iPad.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measurement system designed to evaluate and monitor the physical, mental, and social well-being of adults with sickle cell disease.

Concepts.longName: Adult Sickle Cell Quality of Life Measurement Information System
Concepts.definition: A patient-reported outcome measurement system designed to evaluate and monitor the physical, mental, and social well-being of adults with sickle cell disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition.

Concepts.longName: Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders
Concepts.definition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A project to develop standards for the collection and analysis of patient-reported health status data using a system of highly reliable, precise measures for physical, mental, and social well-being. Patients are asked a series of rigorously reviewed questions covering common domains and metrics across differing conditions and treatments. The questions can be administered in short forms or adaptively through computerized adaptive testing and reports can be generated to allow clinicians to better understand how treatments might affect the quality of life of their patients.

Concepts.longName: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System
Concepts.definition: A project to develop standards for the collection and analysis of patient-reported health status data using a system of highly reliable, precise measures for physical, mental, and social well-being. Patients are asked a series of rigorously reviewed questions covering common domains and metrics across differing conditions and treatments. The questions can be administered in short forms or adaptively through computerized adaptive testing and reports can be generated to allow clinicians to better understand how treatments might affect the quality of life of their patients.
